description: From pyknosis. See Ancient Greek πυκνωτικός (puknōtikós, “serving to close the pores”).

adjectives.description: pyknotic (comparative more pyknotic, superlative most pyknotic)

examples: Several intensely labeled pycnotic bodies point to the occurrence of cell death [...]
rectum of T. derasa showing one morphologically intact zooxanthella and two pycnotic algal cells
